SUMMARY: YdeO activates genes involved in cellular response to acid resistance [12399493, 12694615, 15489450]. This protein, toger with proteins HNS, EvgA, and GadE, pertains to a specific regulatory circuit that is functional in exponential-phase cells growing in minimal medium [12399493, 12694615, 15489450]. Several of genes directly regulated by YdeO are also directly regulated by GadX [12694615]. YdeO belongs to AraC/XylS family of transcriptional regulators and shows more similarity to YhiW, AppY, AdiY, and GadX than or AraC/XylS regulators [9409145, 17712603]. members of this family exhibit two domains, an amino-terminal domain involved in coinducer recognition and dimerization and a carboxy-terminal domain that contains a potential helix-turn-helix DNA-binding motif [9409145, 11282467]. At this time, nothing is known of YdeO DNA-binding sites. ydeO is transcribed in an operon toger with gene safA [12694615]. This gene codes for a protein that directly interacts with PhoQ to activate PhoQ/PhoP system, which regulates genes, including Mg2+ transporters and lipopolysaccharide modification genes [17998538]. YdeO expression is induced by UV irradiation via EvgS/EvgA system and thus controls expression of 21 genes [22790954].
